mytasks.mainSection.title: My Tasks
mytasks.tasks.title: Task #{task} Â· Project #{project}
deleteModal.status.failure: An error occurred when trying to delete this {type}.
deleteModal.title: Confirm that you want to delete the {name} {type}?
signUp.modal.title: Sign up on OpenStreetMap
signup.modal.text1: Tasking Manager works with OpenStreetMap (OSM), a collaborative, open-source map of the world.
signup.modal.text2: Data mapped using the Tasking Manager is available on OpenStreetMap. To get started using the Tasking Manager, first register for an account in OpenStreetMap.
signup.modal.question: Please enter your email address:
signup.modal.redirect: You will be redirect to the OpenStreetMap website after clicking on the button below.
emailUpdate.modal.title: Update your email
emailUpdate.modal.text1: Providing your email address ensures that notifications about your mapping projects will reach you.
emailUpdate.modal.text2: Before you begin mapping, please add your email address.
emailUpdate.modal.privacy_policy: Read our Privacy Policy for more information on how we protect users' personal data.
home.mainSection.title: Map for people in need
home.mainSection.lead: Join a global community putting the world's most vulnerable people and places on the map in order to support humanitarian aid and sustainable development.
home.callToAction.title: We can't do it without you
home.callToAction.firstLeadLine: Anyone can contribute to the map. If you have never mapped before and would like to get started, visit our {link} page.
home.callToAction.secondLeadLine: Are you an experienced mapper? Click below to see what projects are available for mapping.
home.featuredProjects.title: Featured Projects
home.mappingFlow.title: Each year, disasters around the world kill nearly {number} and affect or displace 200 million people. HOT is on a mission to change this.
home.mappingFlow.headLine: Organizations use the Tasking Manager to create mapping projects for areas around the world where data is urgently needed.
home.mappingFlow.cards.mapping.title: Mapping
home.mappingFlow.cards.validation.title: Validation
home.mappingFlow.cards.usingData.title: Using the data
home.mappingFlow.cards.mapping.descripti: Volunteers use satellite imagery from OpenStreetMap to trace buildings, roadways, and other features.
home.mappingFlow.cards.validation.descri: Experience volunteers check the map data to ensure it is high quality.
home.mappingFlow.cards.usingData.descrip: Humanitarian organizations use map data to plan for disaster response activities and deliver critical services to those who need it.
home.whoIsMapping.title: Who is mapping
home.whoIsMapping.headline: Trusted global organizations use Tasking Manager to get the map data they need to reach those in need.
home.whoIsMapping.contact.title: Does your organization want to work with us?
home.whoIsMapping.contact.headline: Contact us to find out how we can work together.
home.contact.contacterHeadText: Want to discuss working with us? Or, have a question or feedback that you would like to share? Fill out the form below to contact our team.
home.testimonials.title: You can make a difference
home.testimonials.michaelYani.citation: Mapping has made me learn how to use a smart phone to collect data and direct people to places they didn't know around the district. I have also started teaching other people how to use smart phones to locate places around the district.
home.testimonials.michaelYani.bio: a refugee from South Sudan who currently resides in Rhino Refugee Settlement
foooter.definition: Tasking Manager is a platform where individuals can support humanitarian response by mapping in OpenStreetMap.
footer.credits: Made by HOTOSM Community. Get in touch.
notifications.mainSection.title: Notifications
management.projects.create.title: Create project
management.projects.clone.message: The new project will be a clone of the project #{id} ({name}).
It was not possible to save your project due to an error: {error}
Your project will be created with {n} tasks.
management.projects.create.trim_tasks.de: Trim the task grid to the area of interest (optional).
You can keep the current tasks or trim the area for your project. This can take some time to execute.
management.projects.create.trim_tasks.tr: Trim the tasks to define the exact Area of Interest for mapping.
management.projects.create.split_task.de: Make tasks smaller by clicking on specific tasks or drawing an area on the map.
management.projects.create.split.tasks.n: A new project will be created with {n} tasks.
management.projects.create.split.tasks.a: The size of each task is approximately {area} km{sq}.
management.projects.create.upload_file.e: Error when importing geometry. Verify if the file you uploaded is correct.
management.projects.create.draw.descript: Draw the Area of Interest on the map.
management.projects.create.upload.descri: Import a GeoJSON, KML, OSM or zipped SHP file.
project.detail.teams.empty: This project doesn't have any teams associated with.
project.detail.questionsAndComments.none: There are currently no questions or comments on this project. Be the first to post one!
project.detail.cards.selectATask.title: 1. Select a task
project.detail.cards.mapthroughosm.title: 2. Map with OpenStreetMap
project.detail.cards.selectATask.descrip: Projects are divided in a set of smaller tasks and adapted to your skill level.
project.detail.cards.mapthroughosm.descr: If you are new to mapping, we recommend checking the Learn page for instructions before you begin.
project.detail.cards.submityourwork.desc: Submitting your work is crucial to make sure your data is saved.
project.detail.sections.contributions.ti: The timeline will be available when at least one task is mapped.
projects.formInputs.privacy.title: Privacy
projects.formInputs.privacy.description: Private means that only the users that are project team members can access, map or validate this project. This option overrides the mapping and validation permissions.
projects.formInputs.teams.title: Teams
projects.formInputs.organisation.title: Organisation
projects.formInputs.organisation.descrip: Organisation that is coordinating the project, if there is any. The managers of that organisation will have administration rights over the project.
projects.formInputs.permissions.level: Only users with intermediate or advanced level
projects.formInputs.permissions.teamsAnd: Only intermediate and advanced team members
Define which users can map this project.
projects.formInputs.permissions.validati: Define which users can validate this project.
projects.sections.mapping_validation.des: Use this if for some reason you need to map, validate or invalidate all tasks in this project in a single step.
projects.actions.message_contributors.de: This will send a message to every contributor of the current project. Please use this feature carefully.
projects.actions.message_contributors.tr: This message will not be translated to the different languages of the users, so you may want to include your own translations.
projects.actions.message_contributors.er: Failed to message all contributors for an unknown reason.
projects.actions.map_all_tasks.title: Map all tasks
projects.actions.map_all_tasks.confirmat: Are you sure you want to mark all tasks in this project as mapped? You cannot undo this.
projects.actions.map_all_tasks.descripti: This will mark all tasks (except 'mapping not possible' ones) as mapped. Please use this only if you are sure of what you are doing.
projects.actions.map_all_tasks.error: Mapping all the tasks failed for an unknown reason.
projects.actions.invalidate_all_tasks.co: Are you sure you want to invalidate all tasks in this project? You cannot undo this.
projects.actions.invalidate_all_tasks.de: This will mark all tasks (except 'needs more mapping' and 'mapping not possible' ones) as invalid. Please use this only if you are sure of what you are doing.
projects.actions.invalidate_all_tasks.er: Invalidating all the tasks failed for an unknown reason.
projects.actions.validate_all_tasks.conf: Are you sure you want to validate all tasks? You cannot undo this.
projects.actions.validate_all_tasks.desc: This will change the status of all tasks (except 'mapping not possible' ones) to 'validated'. Please use this only if you are sure of what you are doing.
projects.actions.validate_all_tasks.erro: Invalidating all the tasks failed for an unknown reason.
projects.actions.reset_bad_imagery_tasks: Reset tasks marked as mapping not possible
Are you sure you want to reset all tasks marked as mapping not possible in this project? You cannot undo this.
This will change the status of those tasks to 'ready'. Please use this only if you are sure of what you are doing.
Reset all mapping not possible tasks
The tasks marked as mapping not possible were reset successfully.
Resetting the tasks failed for an unknown reason.
projects.actions.reset_all_tasks.title: Reset tasks
projects.actions.reset_all_tasks.descrip: Reset all tasks in the project to ready to map, preserving history.
projects.actions.reset_all_tasks.error: Resetting all the tasks failed for an unknown reason.
projects.actions.clone_project.descripti: This will copy all descriptions, instructions, metadata etc to a new project. The Area of Interest, tasks and the priority areas will not be copied. You will have to redraw/import these. Your newly cloned project will be in draft status.
projects.actions.transfer_project.title: Transfer project ownership
projects.actions.transfer_project.alert: In case of wrong transfer, contact the new owner to revert the change.
projects.actions.delete_project.title: Delete project
projects.actions.delete_project.alert: You can only delete projects that has no received contributions.
projects.actions.delete_project.error: The project deletion failed. If this project has received some contributions, you should archive it instead.
projects.actions.task_reset.title: Task reset
projects.actions.task_reset.confirmation: Are you sure you want to reset all tasks? You cannot undo this.
projects.formInputs.random_task_selectio: Enforce random task selection on mapping
If checked, users must edit tasks at random for the initial editing stage (project managers and admins are exempt).
projects.formInputs.imagery.note: Follow this format for TMS URLs: {exampleUrl}
projects.formInputs.name: Name of the project
projects.formInputs.osmcha_filter_id.des: Optional id of a saved OSMCha filter to apply when viewing the project in OSMCha, if you desire custom filtering. Note that this replaces all standard filters. Example: 095e8b31-b3cb-4b36-a106-02826fb6a109 (for convenience, you can also paste an OSMCha URL here that uses a saved filter and the filter id will be extracted for you).
projects.formInputs.priority_areas.descr: If you want mappers to work on the highest priority areas first, draw one or more polygons within the project area.
projects.formInputs.mapper_level.descrip: Setting the level will help mappers to find suitable projects to work on.
projects.formInputs.per_task_instruction: Add any information that can be useful to users while mapping a task. "{x}", "{y}" and "{z}" will be replaced by the corresponding parameters for each task. "{x}", "{y}" and "{z}" parameters can only be be used on tasks generated in the Tasking Manager and not on imported tasks.
Example: This task involves loading extra data. Click [here](http://localhost:8111/import?new_layer=true&url=http://www.domain.com/data/{x}/{y}/{z}/routes_2009.osm) to load the data into JOSM.
projects.formInputs.entitiesToMap.descri: The list of entities that need to be mapped on this project.
projects.formInputs.changesetComment.des: Default comments added to uploaded changeset comment field. Users should also be encouraged to add text describing what they mapped. Hashtags are sometimes used for analysis later, but should be human informative and not overused, #group #event for example.

project.tasks.lock_error.generic.descrip: Some error occurred when trying to lock this task. Check if your user matches the level, role and permissions required by this project.

It is on the Project #{project}. You will need to update the status of that task before you can map another task.
project.tasks.lock_error.current_project: The task #{taskId} was previously locked by you. You will need to update the status of that task before you can map another task.

user.notifications.title: Notifications
user.settings.expert_mode.description: Expert mode makes advanced and experimental features available. Most users should leave this off.
user.settings.default_editor.description: Select the default editor that you want to use when fixing tasks. By selecting this option you will be able to skip the editor selection dialog after selecting a task to map or validate.
user.settings.language.description: Define your prefered language. It will also affect the language of the maps you see on Tasking Manager.
user.settings.become_validator.descripti: If you feel sure of your skills as a mapper and you are looking for a new challenge, apply for the validator role. If your application is successful you can then start to validate other mapper's tasks.
user.notifications.mentions.description: Every time you're mentioned on a comment, you get a notification.
user.notifications.projects.description: You get a notification if any project you've contributed made progress.
user.notifications.comments.description: You get a notification every time someone comments on the project you've contributed to.

pages.about.title: About Tasking Manager
pages.learn.title: Learn
pages.concact.title: Contact Us
home.contact.thanksError: One moment, there was a problem sending your message.
home.contact.thanksBody: You'll be hearing from us soon!
pages.about.description: Tasking Manager is a mapping tool designed and built for the coordination of volunteers and the organization of groups for collaborative mapping in OpenStreetMap.
pages.about.OpenStreetMap.description: {osmLink} is the community-driven free and editable map of the world, supported by the not-for-profit OpenStreetMap Foundation. Read more on the {osmWikiLink} or join the discussion with your local OSM community.
pages.about.howItWorks.title: How does it work?
pages.about.howItWorks.description.part_: A mapping area in OpenStreetMap is divided up into small, individual tasks for volunteer to complete. A simple legend allows users to see which areas still need to be mapped and which areas map data needs to be reviewed for quality assurance.

With Tasking Manager, volunteers can easily see where other mappers are actively mapping, allowing many individuals to map an area together in a coordinated way. This system helps to improve the consistency and quality of mapping.
pages.about.floss.title: Free and Open Source Software
pages.about.floss.description: The Tasking Manager is Free and Open Source software. Please feel free to report issues and contribute.
pages.edit_project.title: Edit project
